sentences.sContent: You've wanted to be a barrister since the year dot.
sentences.sContent_eng: You've wanted to be a barrister since the year dot.
sentences.sCn: 很久以前你就一直想成为一名辩护律师了。

sentences.sContent: The barrister entirely renounce his right to object to a juror.
sentences.sContent_eng: The barrister entirely renounce his right to object to a juror.
sentences.sCn: 这位律师完全放弃了反对陪审团成员的权力。

sentences.sContent: Our case was argued by an able barrister, who reduced the prosecutor's submissions almost to nothing.
sentences.sContent_eng: Our case was argued by an able barrister, who reduced the prosecutor's submissions almost to nothing.
sentences.sCn: 我们的案子由一位很有能力的律师为我们辩护，他驳得原告的呈辞一无是处。

synos.tran: 律师；（加拿大）出庭律师（等于arrister-at-law）；（英）（有资格出席高等法庭并辩护的）专门律师

remMethod.val: barr(看作bar， 律师业) + ister(表人) → 律师

trans.tranOther: a lawyer in Britain who can argue cases in the higher law courts
